title: Update Valentine app: default name to Hina Sadat, add more dialogues, and make the 'No' button move only on tap/click

requirements.text: Set the appâ€™s default displayed name to "Hina Sadat" (instead of the current default "Ghazal") and ensure the editable name field is prefilled with "Hina Sadat" on first load.

quotes: Make one with the name Hina Sadat.

acceptanceCriteria: On first load, the large title name shows "Hina Sadat".
On first load, the name input value is "Hina Sadat".
No other part of the UI still defaults to "Ghazal".

requirements.text: Expand the rotating "No"-button dialogue list to include many more messages (significantly more than the current list) and continue cycling messages as the user repeatedly taps/clicks "No".
acceptanceCriteria: The in-code list of "No" messages is noticeably larger than the current list.
Each time the user taps/clicks "No", the button label updates to the next dialogue (cycling through the full set).

requirements.text: Change the "No" button behavior so it moves to a new position only when the user clicks/taps it, and it must not move on hover or mere touch/hover proximity.

quotes: when the no is clicked it should move around only when its clicked or tapped

acceptanceCriteria: Hovering the "No" button with a mouse does not move it.
Touching near the "No" button without activating it does not move it.
Clicking/tapping the "No" button moves it to a new position and updates the dialogue label.
On mobile devices, a single tap triggers a single move (no double-trigger from both touch and click).

requirements.text: Ensure the main interaction layout (name header, question, and Yes/No buttons) fits comfortably on phone-sized screens without horizontal overflow; adjust button sizing/stacking as needed for small viewports while preserving the existing visual style.

quotes: should fit even on a phone

acceptanceCriteria: On a narrow viewport (~360px wide), content does not overflow horizontally.
Yes/No buttons remain fully visible and tappable without requiring zoom.
The "No" button movement stays within the visible button container area on small screens.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only shadcn components).
Backend must remain single-actor; only add backend logic if strictly required (this change set should remain frontend-only).
nonGoals: Adding Internet Identity authentication flows (not requested).
Persisting dialogues or user state to the backend.
Adding new pages/routes or a multi-screen experience.
